intro: Scorzonera tau-saghyz subsp. longipes, commonly known as the long-stemmed scorzonera, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its tuberous roots, which are often used for their medicinal properties. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It features upright stems with narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces yellowish to orange flowers in the summer. Its botanical structure reflects its evolutionary adaptation to survive in harsh, semi-desert conditions.
